function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of explicit design strategies and guidelines for translating biophilic design into architectural design","Impact":"Inability to effectively incorporate biophilic design into architectural projects, leading to missed opportunities for health and well-being benefits","Mitigation":"Conducting interdisciplinary research to develop specific design strategies and guidelines for implementing biophilic design in architecture","Technologies":"Interdisciplinary collaboration, data analysis, and evidence-based design approaches","People":"Architects, designers, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, architectural firms, government bodies"},{"Description":"Lack of validation for the effectiveness of biophilic design in buildings","Impact":"Inability to measure the performance and benefits of biophilic buildings, leading to uncertainty about the value of incorporating biophilic design","Mitigation":"Conducting qualitative and quantitative research to evaluate the performance of biophilic buildings and develop concrete metrics for assessment","Technologies":"Data analytics, sensor technologies, building performance evaluations","People":"Architects, building owners, occupants","Owner":"Building technology companies, research institutions, architectural firms"},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of financial matters and building technology in biophilic architecture","Impact":"Risk of financial inefficiency and technical defects in biophilic buildings, leading to potential negative outcomes for occupants and stakeholders","Mitigation":"Collaboration between architects, building technology experts, and finance professionals to address financial and technical aspects of biophilic architecture","Technologies":"Building information modeling (BIM), sustainable materials and construction techniques, financial analysis tools","People":"Architects, building technology experts, finance professionals","Owner":"Architectural firms, construction companies, finance institutions"}]}
